oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Survey of veterinarians suggests knowledge gaps regarding animal disposal following pentobarbital euthanasia of cattle and small ruminants
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hess, W.
Kollias, N.
Pikel, L.
Johnson, C.
Cornwell, E.
Golab, G.
Bright-Ponte, S.
Murphy, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Veterinarians, animal owners, and the animal food industry share responsibility to properly dispose of euthanized animals and prevent pentobarbital from entering the animal food sup足ply. To better understand current veterinary practices regard足ing disposal of animals following pentobarbital euthanasia so that targeted outreach could be developed, the FDA Center for Veterinary Medicine (CVM) and the American Veterinary Medi足cal Association (AVMA) conducted a survey of AVMA members on euthanasia and subsequent disposal practices. This presen足tation will focus on the results of the survey as they apply to disposal of cattle and small ruminants and resulting planned outreach efforts.
